meanings.definition: A set of elements with an associative binary operation.
meanings.sent1: In math class, we learned about semigroups and how they combine elements together.
meanings.sent2: The semigroups in algebra help us understand how operations work on different elements.
meanings.sent3: The semigroups at the math party were always associating with each other!
meanings.sent4: The concept of semigroups is like a puzzle where each piece fits perfectly with the others.
meanings.sent5: Imagine semigroups as a group of friends who always stick together and follow the same rules.

meanings.definition: A mathematical structure with closure and associativity.
meanings.sent1: The semigroups in our textbook show how operations are closed and associative.
meanings.sent2: Understanding semigroups is crucial for solving complex mathematical problems.
meanings.sent3: The semigroups in the math competition were so friendly and closed off from others!
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked like semigroups, always ensuring things were closed and connected.
meanings.sent5: The concept of semigroups is like a well-organized club where everyone follows the rules and sticks together.
